Creating an incoming webhook gives you a unique URL to which you send a JSON payload with the message text and some options. You can use all the usual formatting and layout blocks with incoming webhooks to make the messages stand out."/><meta data-rh=true property=og:description content="Incoming webhooks are a way to post messages from apps into Slack. Creating an incoming webhook gives you a unique URL to which you send a JSON payload with the message text and some options. .649.18.828.45l4.996 7.492c.11.148.168.347.168.55zm0 0"/></g></svg></button></div></div></aside><main class=docMainContainer_TBSr><div class="container padding-top--md padding-bottom--lg"><div class=row><div class="col docItemCol_VOVn"><div class=docItemContainer_Djhp><article><nav class="theme-doc-breadcrumbs breadcrumbsContainer_Z_bl" aria-label=Breadcrumbs><ul class=breadcrumbs><li class=breadcrumbs__item><a aria-label="Home page" class=breadcrumbs__link href=/><svg viewBox="0 0 24 24" class=breadcrumbHomeIcon_YNFT><path d="M10 19v-5h4v5c0 .55.45 1 1 1h3c.55 0 1-.45 1-1v-7h1.7c.46 0 .68-.57.33-.87L12.67 3.6c-.38-.34-.96-.34-1.34 0l-8.36 7.53c-.34.3-.13.87.33.87H5v7c0 .55.45 1 1 1h3c.55 0 1-.45 1-1z" fill=currentColor /></svg></a><li class=breadcrumbs__item><a class=breadcrumbs__link href=/messaging/><span>Messaging</span></a><li class="breadcrumbs__item breadcrumbs__item--active"><span class=breadcrumbs__link>Sending messages using incoming webhooks</span></ul></nav><div class="tocCollapsible_ETCw theme-doc-toc-mobile tocMobile_ITEo"><button type=button class="clean-btn tocCollapsibleButton_TO0P">On this page</button></div><div class="theme-doc-markdown markdown"><header><h1>Sending messages using incoming webhooks</h1></header>
```html
<p>Incoming webhooks are a way to post messages from apps into Slack. Creating an incoming webhook gives you a unique URL to which you send a <a href=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/JSON target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer" class="">JSON</a> payload with the message text and some options. You can use all the usual <a class="" href=/messaging/formatting-message-text>formatting</a> and <a class="" href=/messaging#complex_layouts>layout blocks</a> with incoming webhooks to make the messages stand out.</p>
<p>If you're looking for the Help Center article on using webhooks with Workflow Builder, <a href=https://slack.com/help/articles/360041352714 target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer" class="">head over here</a>. Otherwise, read on!</p>
<hr/>
<h2 class="anchor anchorTargetStickyNavbar_Vzrq" id=getting_started>Getting started with incoming webhooks<a href=#getting_started class=hash-link aria-label="Direct link to Getting started with incoming webhooks" title="Direct link to Getting started with incoming webhooks" translate=no>‚Äã</a></h2>
<p>We're going to walk through a 4-step process (if you've already done some of these things it'll be even easier) that will have you posting messages using incoming webhooks in just a few minutes:</p>
<h3 class="anchor anchorTargetStickyNavbar_Vzrq" id=create-app>1. Create a Slack app (if you don't have one already)<a href=#create-app class=hash-link aria-label="Direct link to 1. Create a Slack app (if you don't have one already)" title="Direct link to 1. Create a Slack app (if you don't have one already)" translate=no>‚Äã</a></h3>
<p><a href="https://api.slack.com/apps?new_app=1" target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer"><button type=button class="button purpleButton button--primary" aria-disabled=false>Create an app</button></a></p>
<p>Pick a name, choose a workspace to associate your app with (bear in mind you'll probably be posting lots of test messages, so you may want to create a channel for sandbox use), then click <strong>Create App</strong>. If you've already created an app, you can use that one. Have a treat for being prepared! üç™</p>
<h3 class="anchor anchorTargetStickyNavbar_Vzrq" id=enable_webhooks>2. Enable incoming webhooks<a href=#enable_webhooks class=hash-link aria-label="Direct link to 2. Enable incoming webhooks" title="Direct link to 2. Enable incoming webhooks" translate=no>‚Äã</a></h3>
<p>You'll be redirected to the settings page for your new app (if you're using an existing app, you can load its settings via your <a href=https://api.slack.com/apps target=_blank rel="noopener noreferrer" class="">app's management dashboard</a>).</p>
<p>From here, select <strong>Incoming Webhooks</strong>, and toggle <strong>Activate Incoming Webhooks</strong> to on. If you already have this activated, well, you deserve another treat! üç™</p>
<h3 class="anchor anchorTargetStickyNavbar_Vzrq" id=create_a_webhook>3. Create an incoming webhook<a href=#create_a_webhook class=hash-link aria-label="Direct link to 3. Create an incoming webhook" title="Direct link to 3. Create an incoming webhook" translate=no>‚Äã</a></h3>
<p>Now that incoming webhooks are enabled, the settings page should refresh and some additional options will appear. One of those options is a very helpful button called <strong>Add New Webhook to Workspace</strong> ‚Äî click it!</p>
<p>What this button does is trigger a shortcut version of the installation flow for Slack apps, one that is completely self-contained so that you don't have to actually build any code to generate an incoming webhook URL. We'll <a href=#incoming_webhooks_programmatic class="">show how you can generate webhooks programmatically later</a>, but for now, you'll see something like the following:</p>
<div class="container center"><div class=row><div class=col><p><img decoding=async loading=lazy alt="Permissions screen with incoming webhooks channel selector" src="data:image/png;base64," width=464 height=395 class=img_ev3q /></div><div class=col><p>Go ahead and pick a channel that the app will post to, then select <strong>Authorize</strong>. If you need to add the incoming webhook to a private channel, you must first be in that channel.</div></div></div>
<p>You'll be sent back to your app settings, where you should see a new entry under the <strong>Webhook URLs for Your Workspace</strong> section. Your webhook URL will look something like this:</p>
<div class="language-http codeBlockContainer_Ckt0 theme-code-block" style=--prism-color:#F8F8F2;--prism-background-color:#282A36><div class=codeBlockContent_QJqH><pre tabindex=0 class="prism-code language-http codeBlock_bY9V thin-scrollbar" style=color:#F8F8F2;background-color:#282A36><code class=codeBlockLines_e6Vv><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">https://hooks.slack.com/services/T00000000/B00000000/XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX</span><br/></span></code></pre></div></div>
<p>That URL is your shiny new incoming webhook, one that's specific to a single user and a single channel.</p>
<div class="theme-admonition theme-admonition-info admonition_xJq3 alert alert--info"><div class=admonitionHeading_Gvgb><span class=admonitionIcon_Rf37><svg viewBox="0 0 14 16"><path fill-rule=evenodd d="M7 2.3c3.14 0 5.7 2.56 5.7 5.7s-2.56 5.7-5.7 5.7A5.71 5.71 0 0 1 1.3 8c0-3.14 2.56-5.7 5.7-5.7zM7 1C3.14 1 0 4.14 0 8s3.14 7 7 7 7-3.14 7-7-3.14-7-7-7zm1 3H6v5h2V4zm0 6H6v2h2v-2z"/></svg></span>For GovSlack devs</div><div class=admonitionContent_BuS1><p>If you're developing a <a class="" href=/govslack>GovSlack</a> app for use by public sector customers, make your API calls to the <code>slack-gov.com</code> domain instead of the <code>slack.com</code> domain.</div></div>
<p>Let's see how you can actually use that webhook to post a message.</p>
<div class="theme-admonition theme-admonition-info admonition_xJq3 alert alert--info"><div class=admonitionHeading_Gvgb><span class=admonitionIcon_Rf37><svg viewBox="0 0 14 16"><path fill-rule=evenodd d="M7 2.3c3.14 0 5.7 2.56 5.7 5.7s-2.56 5.7-5.7 5.7A5.71 5.71 0 0 1 1.3 8c0-3.14 2.56-5.7 5.7-5.7zM7 1C3.14 1 0 4.14 0 8s3.14 7 7 7 7-3.14 7-7-3.14-7-7-7zm1 3H6v5h2V4zm0 6H6v2h2v-2z"/></svg></span>Keep it secret, keep it safe</div><div class=admonitionContent_BuS1><p>Your webhook URL contains a secret. Don't share it online, including via public version control repositories. <strong>Slack actively searches out and revokes leaked secrets.</strong></div></div>
<h3 class="anchor anchorTargetStickyNavbar_Vzrq" id=posting_with_webhooks>4. Use your incoming webhook URL to post a message<a href=#posting_with_webhooks class=hash-link aria-label="Direct link to 4. Use your incoming webhook URL to post a message" title="Direct link to 4. Use your incoming webhook URL to post a message" translate=no>‚Äã</a></h3>
<p>Later in this doc we'll explain <a href=#advanced_message_formatting class="">how to make your messages more expressive or interactive</a>, but for right now anything will do, so we're going to use that old standby ‚Äî "Hello, world".</p>
<p>Make an HTTP POST request like this:</p>
<div class="language-http codeBlockContainer_Ckt0 theme-code-block" style=--prism-color:#F8F8F2;--prism-background-color:#282A36><div class=codeBlockContent_QJqH><pre tabindex=0 class="prism-code language-http codeBlock_bY9V thin-scrollbar" style=color:#F8F8F2;background-color:#282A36><code class=codeBlockLines_e6Vv><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">POST https://hooks.slack.com/services/T00000000/B00000000/XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">Content-type: application/json</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">{</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">    "text": "Hello, world."</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">}</span><br/></span></code></pre></div></div>
<p>The URL that you're making the POST request to should be the same URL you generated in the previous step.</p>
<p>That's it! Go and check the channel your app was installed into, and you'll see that the "Hello, World" message has been posted by your app.</p>
<p>You can use this in a real Slack app without much change, just substitute your favorite HTTP Request library for cURL and structure all the requests in the exact same way. You'll also need to pay attention to some details <a href=#incoming_webhooks_programmatic class="">we've outlined below</a> when you're distributing your app.</p>
<div class="theme-admonition theme-admonition-info admonition_xJq3 alert alert--info"><div class=admonitionHeading_Gvgb><span class=admonitionIcon_Rf37><svg viewBox="0 0 14 16"><path fill-rule=evenodd d="M7 2.3c3.14 0 5.7 2.56 5.7 5.7s-2.56 5.7-5.7 5.7A5.71 5.71 0 0 1 1.3 8c0-3.14 2.56-5.7 5.7-5.7zM7 1C3.14 1 0 4.14 0 8s3.14 7 7 7 7-3.14 7-7-3.14-7-7-7zm1 3H6v5h2V4zm0 6H6v2h2v-2z"/></svg></span>Incoming webhooks do not allow you to delete a message after it's been posted.</div><div class=admonitionContent_BuS1><p>If you need a more complex chat flow including message deletion, call <a class="" href=/reference/methods/chat.postMessage><code>chat.postMessage</code></a>.</div></div>
<p>Great work, you've set up incoming webhooks for your Slack app and made a successful test call, and you're ready to start making those messages more interesting and useful. We baked some extra treats to celebrate! üç™üç™üç™üç™</p>
<hr/>
<h2 class="anchor anchorTargetStickyNavbar_Vzrq" id=advanced_message_formatting>Making it fancy with advanced formatting<a href=#advanced_message_formatting class=hash-link aria-label="Direct link to Making it fancy with advanced formatting" title="Direct link to Making it fancy with advanced formatting" translate=no>‚Äã</a></h2>
<p>Incoming webhooks conform to the same rules and functionality as any of our other messaging APIs. You can make your posted messages just a single line of text, or use <a class="" href=/messaging/creating-interactive-messages>interactive components</a>.</p>
<video autoplay loop muted playsinline style=width:100%><source src=/img/guides/buttons_simple_example.mp4 type=video/mp4 /></video>
<p>The process of using all these extras and features is similar to <a href=#posting_with_webhooks class="">the one explained above</a>. The only difference is the JSON payload that you send to your webhook URL will contain other fields in addition to <code>text</code>. Here's a more advanced HTTP request example that you can use with the same webhook <code>url</code> that you <a href=#posting_with_webhooks class="">used above</a>:</p>
<div class="language-http codeBlockContainer_Ckt0 theme-code-block" style=--prism-color:#F8F8F2;--prism-background-color:#282A36><div class=codeBlockContent_QJqH><pre tabindex=0 class="prism-code language-http codeBlock_bY9V thin-scrollbar" style=color:#F8F8F2;background-color:#282A36><code class=codeBlockLines_e6Vv><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">POST https://hooks.slack.com/services/T00000000/B00000000/XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">Content-type: application/json</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">{</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">    "text": "Danny Torrence left a 1 star review for your property.",</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">    "blocks": [</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">    	{</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">    		"type": "section",</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">    		"text": {</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">    			"type": "mrkdwn",</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">    			"text": "Danny Torrence left the following review for your property:"</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">    		}</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">    	},</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">    	{</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">    		"type": "section",</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">    		"block_id": "section567",</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">    		"text": {</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">    			"type": "mrkdwn",</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">    			"text": "&lt;https://example.com|Overlook Hotel> \n :star: \n Doors had too many axe holes, guest in room 237 was far too rowdy, whole place felt stuck in the 1920s."</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">    		},</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">    		"accessory": {</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">    			"type": "image",</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">    			"image_url": "https://is5-ssl.mzstatic.com/image/thumb/Purple3/v4/d3/72/5c/d3725c8f-c642-5d69-1904-aa36e4297885/source/256x256bb.jpg",</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">    			"alt_text": "Haunted hotel image"</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">    		}</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">    	},</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">    	{</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">    		"type": "section",</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">    		"block_id": "section789",</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">    		"fields": [</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">    			{</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">    				"type": "mrkdwn",</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">    				"text": "*Average Rating*\n1.0"</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">    			}</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">    		]</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">    	}</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">    ]</span><br/></span><span class=token-line style=color:#F8F8F2><span class="token plain">}</span><br/></span></code></pre></div></div>
<p>This example uses <a class="" href=/block-kit>Block Kit</a> visual components to make the message more expressive and 
```
